definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: what we call a Federal Depository Receipt.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的收據我們稱爲聯邦存儲收據。

sentences.english: what we call a Federal Depository Receipt.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的收據我們稱爲聯邦存儲收據。

sentences.english: S: Yes, you can. Bring your card and receipt to replace it at Lao Jie Station.
sentences.chinese: 可以拿收據到老街地鐵站換。

sentences.english: After I paid the money, the shop assistant gave me a receipt.
sentences.chinese: 我付過錢之後，店員便給了我一張收據。

sentences.english: Vendor name on a printed receipt should be in a decodable format.
sentences.chinese: 收據上的商家名稱應該是可解碼的格式。

sentences.english: Tow guy: The government is impounding it.
sentences.chinese: 政府沒收了，這是你的收據。

sentences.english: Original receipts must be presented before redemption at Neways Singapore Product Showcase.
sentences.chinese: 在領取贈品時必需附上收據。

sentences.english: When you have paid for something, a receipt is given to you.
sentences.chinese: 當你付了某個東中的錢時，就給你收據。

sentences.english: I comes with original receipt, dust bag, and tags.
sentences.chinese: 您可以收到原配的收據，灰塵袋，和標記條。

sentences.english: S11: Here's your receipt, and this is your purchase.
sentences.chinese: 這是收據，這是您買的東西。

sentences.english: So today, we're announcing the first-ever federal taxpayer receipt.
sentences.chinese: 所以，今天我們發佈了首份聯邦納稅人稅收收據。

sentences.english: Pick up your Host Organizing Committee gift bag with the voucher in your registration packet.
sentences.chinese: 領取你的地主籌備委員會禮品袋連同你註冊袋之收據。

sentences.english: An official receipt will be issued for donation of HK$100 or above.
sentences.chinese: 凡捐款港幣一百元或以上，可獲發正式收據。

sentences.english: When do you think it convenient to hand in the Mate's Receipts for your signature?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲什麼時候交來大副收據讓你簽字合適？

sentences.english: Please give me an interim receipt.
sentences.chinese: 請給我一張臨時的收據。

sentences.english: Official receipts will be issued for donation of HK$100 or above.
sentences.chinese: 捐款港幣一百元或以上，方可獲發捐款收據。

definition: to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
